title: Ex-Trump lawyer settles lawsuit for $1.7m in alleged unpaid fees
description: Former lawyer Michael Cohen is set to play a central role in criminal charges against Donald Trump in New York.

title: UN expert slams Syria detention of minors over parents’ ISIL ties
description: Visit to northeastern Syria by UN rapporteur finds 'cradle-to-grave detention' of children violates international law.

title: Biden picks woman to lead Navy in possible history-making move
description: If confirmed by the Senate, Admiral Lisa Franchetti would become first woman to lead Navy branch of the US military.

title: Guatemala police raid office of Semilla presidential candidate
description: Guatemala is on edge as the attorney general's office targets one of the two leading parties in the presidential race.

title: Texas university president resigns in latest US race-related row
description: Race, education and inclusivity programmes have become the latest fronts in the 'culture wars'.

title: Will Spain shift to the right?
description: Socialist prime minister faces serious challenge in Sunday's early elections.

title: MSF says armed men attacked aid workers in Sudan
description: Doctors Without Borders says security situation has dramatically deteriorated, putting activities in Khartoum at risk.

title: Any Polish aggression on Belarus is attack on Russia, Putin says
description: President says Russia will retaliate against any attack on ally. Poland denies having territorial ambitions in Belarus.

title: Israeli forces kill 17-year-old Palestinian in occupied West Bank
description: Muhammad Fouad Atta al-Bayed died of a gunshot would to the head, the Palestinian health ministry says.

title: ‘Transformational’ moment: Lionel Messi set for Inter Miami debut
description: The Argentinian World Cup winner can help boost Major League Soccer and interest in football in the US, experts say.

title: UN food agency worker killed in Yemen
description: Yemen's health minister says WFP employee was killed in an attack in Taiz, calling on authorities to 'arrest criminals'.

title: India, Sri Lanka agree to boost economic and energy ties
description: Sri Lankan president's visit to India signals growing ties as neighbours agree to boost cooperation in various sectors.

title: What is happening in India’s Manipur?
description: Viral clip showing dozens of men parading around two women stripped naked and and assaulting them has triggered outrage.

title: Russia detains ex-separatist commander Igor Girkin
description: The Russian nationalist, who criticised the way Russia is running its war in Ukraine, was taken from his home in Moscow.

title: Legendary US singer Tony Bennett dies at 96
description: Bennett was the last of the great saloon singers, whose devotion to classic songs graced a decades-long career.

title: Trial in Donald Trump’s classified documents case set for May
description: Jury trial of former US president to begin on May 20, less than six months before presidential election.

title: Swedish embassy in Iraq relocates after attack over Quran burning
description: Swedish telecoms company Ericsson also looking into reports that Iraq has suspended its work permits there.

title: Pakistan election body says ready for national polls in October
description: Five-year tenure of national and provincial assemblies ends on August 12, with new elections to be held within 60 days.

title: Concern mounts in East Africa over halted Black Sea grain deal
description: Analysts say East Africa could experience food shortages due to complications from Russia exiting the grain initiative.

title: Lithuanian border towns grapple with threat of Russia-Ukraine war
description: Lithuanians in towns near Belarus feel unsafe despite authorities bolstering border security amid ongoing Ukraine war.

title: Sunak’s Conservatives lose two out of three seats in key UK vote
description: Britain's governing party avoids wipeout in special polls seen as test of public support before next year's general vote

title: Women in India set fire to house of Manipur assault main suspect
description: The person allegedly dragged two tribal women onto streets in May and later incited mob to rape and parade them naked.

title: A silent emergency: The rise in suicides among UK doctors
description: Intense workloads, bullying, lack of support. Why are medics more likely to die by suicide than the general population?

title: The Supreme Court is so corrupt …
description: it makes corruption legal.

title: NASA issues July heat warning as temperatures remain high
description: A wave of extreme heat, wildfires, torrential rain and flooding has wreaked havoc around the world in recent days.

title: US vs Vietnam preview: Hot favourites face Asian dark horses
description: The US open their campaign against Vietnam as they seek a third consecutive title in captain Rapinoe's last World Cup.

title: Countries summon Sweden’s ambassadors to protest Quran burning
description: Sweden's ambassadors summoned by various countries to lodge protest over incidents in Stockholm.

title: Guinea Bissau pauses teachers’ pay to weed out fictitious workers
description: Guinea Bissau, which depends largely on foreign aid to pay teachers' salaries, made the decision on July 18.

title: Abbas, Netanyahu to visit Turkey just days apart
description: Leaders to separately discuss 'Turkey-Palestine relations' and 'Israeli-Palestinian conflict' with Erdogan.

title: How Afghan women secretly learn judo — over WhatsApp
description: A one-time Afghan national coach and his former student are training women in Afghanistan virtually from Norway.

title: Australia blocks acquisition of lithium mine by China-linked firm
description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers prevents Austroid Corporation from acquiring Alita Resources after advice from investment board.

title: Are you ready for a digital death?
description: Who gets your WhatsApp messages, passwords and crypto assets when you pass? It's getting more complicated to die.

title: Japan’s inflation speeds up as central bank weighs interest rates
description: Prices in world's third-largest economy grew 3.3 percent in June amid expectations BOJ will stick to ultra-loose policy.

title: Russia’s exit from grain deal puts focus on Asia’s food prices
description: Analysts say food prices in Asia are likely to rise but the fallout will be limited for the time being.

title: US says Ukraine’s use of cluster bombs against Russia ‘effective’
description: White House national security spokesman says controversial US-provided bombs used against Russian military positions.

title: Google developing AI tools to help journalists report the news
description: Tech giant says AI-powered tool is not intended to replace 'essential' role journalists play in covering the news.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 513
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 513th day.
